result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose Miguel Suarez Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>10-50g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: 15CM200,16CF79,15CF220 and any other sentence previously ordered.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant's Financial obligations will be collected pursuant to the policy of the Department of Corrections.

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!

Def is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.
  Def is to obtain anger management counseling and to complete recommended treatment;  with the Def finding the funding for such counseling.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are possessed or consumed.
Defendant is not to possess any drug packaging materials.
  Not to associate with any known drug users or those involved in trafficking, other than in a professional group counseling setting,meeting, or in a correctional setting.
  Any contraband seized to be forfeited!
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
  NO CONTACT with Jolena Dashner
  NO CONTACT with Ashland WalMart.
Defendant is to complete any other program ordered by Department of Corrections.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

supervisions.notes:
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
Consecutive to: 15CM200,16CF79,15CF220 and any other sentence previously ordered.

Defendant Jose Miguel Suarez in court with attorney Martin J Lipske.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  4 cases. DA McKnight agreement at the time that the parties entered free to argue, plea cap 15yrs 10in 5 ES, Def/Atty Lipske state this is the Agreement. State has complied with vic rights, nothing to provide court. No victim in court for statement. NO corrections to PSI. DA comments on sent 15CF220  3 1/2 1 1/2 IN  2ES each count CC, 16CF9 7IN 2 yrs ES CS to 220, 16CF79 1 1/2IN 1 yr ES CS to 220 and 9, 15CM200 30 days jail, doesnt endorse concurrent sentences, should be sentenced independently, comments on sentencing,  compass evaluation most high needs/risk person he has ever seen. Absol,no MAS, aoda, cog, anger managment, couns, nodru, NC Edward mcmackiel, jolena dashner, walmart, dna.  Atty Lipske comments on sentencing, recieved copy of letter from McMackiel 5/31, ct has reviewed letter, asks for boot camp, asks for 5yr sent for jail violation 2 IN 3 ES, 16CF9 rec 4yrs IN 8ES, 9mo sent for McMackiel incident, asks for substance abuse treatment, boot camp, earned release, anger man, cog, CTS 665 days,nc walmart, jolena dashner, costs, asks for oppertunity to change his life. Def statement. Ct asks if there is any reason why sentence should not be pronounced "no". 
15CM200 120 days Jail. CS 90 days CTS good time.
16CF79 270 days jail. CS-203 CTS good time.
15CF220 pos meth 18mo IN 18mo ES firearm 24mo IN 24mo ES concurrent to one another. CS to others. 63 days CTS
16CF9 5yr IN 8ES sentences in each case run CS. 0 CTS
All sentences CS to any other sentence previously ordered. 322 CTS. Ct reviews WEDS with def.  Conditions ES absol, no mas, rx as pres, no para, no packaging materials, not pres, nodru, no gun, ua, nc with jolena dashner, walmart ashland, dna, contra, cog, anger manag, aoda, other program by DOC. 15CM200 $465.15 16CF79 $543.90 15CF220 ct1 $543.90 ct2 $543.90 firearm forfeited 16CF9 $543.90 25% out of all prison wages. After release pay these through DOC. IS EL IS EL.
No gun no vote.
Atty will go over appeal rights.
of Requirements and Penalties under 941.29/941.291

Defendant Jose Miguel Suarez in court with attorney Martin J Lipske.  Kelly McKnight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 6 cases DA understanding that there is an agreement as to plea and parties will request PSI. Def will plea to Ct1 15CM200, Ct1 in 15CF220, Ct2 CF220, Ct3 CF9 and Ct1 79. State will move to DRI any other charge/cases. 17CF9 motion to amend the information in this case to 6yrs max penalty, so ordered. Def pleads NC to each of the 5 counts. Admits repeater statuses. in 16CF79 admits amount. 
DRI 15CM200 Ct 2 and 3, 15CF220 Ct 3-5, 15CF223, 16CF9 Ct4-6, 16CF79,16CF23. Ct reviews elements/penalties. Ct accepts pleas and finds def guilty. Ct orders PSI. 
In regard to bail, bail is REVOKED. 

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 15, 2017 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: 15CF220, 15CF223, 15CF200, 16CF9, 16CF23, 16CF79, Defendant Jose Miguel Suarez in court with attorney Brian William Severson. Atty appears by phone.  Defendant Jose Miguel Suarez in custody  appears by ACJ VCon.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Dan Linehan appears by telephone, he represent Jose Smart whose case is joined with Suarz's for trial.  Rec motion from Severson asking to withdraw as attorney.  Motion being made at request of defendant.  Def agrees that it is his request.  Ct takes look at cases and wondering when next trial date is.... Tuesday, January 17th on 16CF79 and a trial date for Februar 2, 3 on 16CF220.    Ct questions Suarex - wrote a letter December 14th have not talked to atty since November and not comfortable with that as well, left messages, emails, etc and just talked to him first time two three days ago and first time talked to him in 60 days.  15CF220 Judge  states he was originally represented by Atty Kratz.  Atty Kratz withdrew because of different conflict, then reprsented by Atty Riley, def has no idea why he withdrew, did not fire him, he withdrew and then Severson came on.  Severson first atty he is asking to discharge.  Wants to seek a different attorney, thru SPD office, asking trial date be adjourned.  VR issue in 16CF79.  Severson says he could talk to SPD and he indicated if order by court then he would withdraw and then SPD would appoint a successor of counsel since this is first time Suarez asking atty to withdraw. Mcknight also revieed the record and process by which got to Atty Severson and agree that it is of no fault to Suarez that he is on his third atty.  Mcknight is ready for trial but not an unreasonable request.  Court provides information to Suarez first regarding giving up right to atty.   Court grants motion to withdraw in EACH Case and still retains right to attorney and cant proceed with JT in 16CF79 on January 17th as no way attorney can prepare for one at that time.  Scheduling Conference - 02-06-17 at 1:10 p.m. on these cases.  Linehan will also be available.  16CF79 and Mr. Smart's case also scheduled.  Attys may appear by telephone.  And trial for February 2, and 3rd is OFF.  Atty's disconnect from call.  Bail Modification:  -   Suarez will this motion up to the new attorney.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 6, 2017 at 01:10 pm.

Prosecuting Atty Kelly J Mcknight appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jose Miguel Suarez appeared by video means. Court attempted to contact Atty Severson, message left. Atty Linehan appr by phone for the Jose Smart case 16CF10-status of this case, offers made requests trial. Back on the record 2:09 pm with Atty Severson (all cases). No cases settled. Atty Severson has filed motion to withdraw on Friday. MH 1/12/17 1:15pm
and Order to Withdraw

Attorney John Charles Bachman in court for Defendant Jose Antonio Smart. Prosecuting Atty Kelly J Mcknight appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jose Antonio Smart appeared by video means. Atty Bachman def asks atty to withdraw from case, does not want to discuss the case with him, wants another atty. Offer made by DA which atty has not been able to discuss with atty.  Def has asked atty to withdraw. Def asks for adjournment of the trial. DA does not want to do two seperate trials.  Ct grants motion to withdraw, Def wants new councel, trial is adjourned. Trial for coactor is also canceled. Clerk to set up defendants to appr by phone for scheduling conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 7, 2016 at 01:10 pm.

Defendant Jose Miguel Suarez in court with attorney Brian William Severson appearing by phone. Kelly McNight  appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty has not talked with def yet it is getting set up. State filed motion to adj trial 16CF79. Atty has no obj but the bond should be considered on this. DA has complied with vic rights on 16CF79. received no response back from victim. Ct asks why this is a important witness. DA comments was the Doctor at the time of injury. CT will hear motion to adj by itself and not with motion to modify bail. Back on the record. Def talked priv. with atty. DA comments on motion- Dr. Shrader yesterday and called office that he will be out of the country , DA filed motion to adj. DA does not know when he will be back. Ct asks id DA could get deposition. CT comments testimony can be taken by deposition. Ct comments agrees with State that witness is expert witness. Grants states motion to adjourn. Def has trial coming up with co-def October 12-13. DA comments 15CF220 has dates of analyst DA comments 2 day trial. will ready January. 15CF220 Jury trial 12 per son number 1 Feb 2, 2017 2 day trial. All cases come in together on upcoming STC hearing.  16CF79- DA would like this sched. after the trial on 15CF220. Atty comments would like it sooner. Ct comments will look at sched next week after the trial.  Jury trial scheduled for February 2, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Judge Eaton Appear by telephone. Defendant Jose Miguel Suarez appeared by video means from the Ashland County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Kelly J Mcknight appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Brian William Severson appeared by phone means for Defendant Jose Miguel Suarez. Also case 16CF10, Atty John Bachman appear by phone and Jose Smart appr by phone.  DA no updates on the status of the upcoming trial. Atty Severson, trial still on are having discussions. Atty Bachman, trial on, difficult communicating with with def at the prison asks that def be brought to ACJ as soon as possible easier for him to converse with def there. DA motion filed could be heard the morning of trial. Atty Severson/Bachman no unfiled motions at this time. Clerk order to transport Smart by Thursday.

Defendant Jose Miguel Suarez in court with attorney Brian William Severson.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion hearing 15CF220. Cases 15CF223,15CM200,16CF79,23 and 9 tracking.  DA no agreement on motion. State has physical evidence that would be intraduced at trial . Atty Severson suppression of evidence from the search of vehicle. States position is that veh was impounded, case law, APD policy exception to search warrant requirment. Not valid inventory search per Atty Severson. 
State calls Sgt Michelle Tutor, sworn, exam. Cross. Redirect. Recross. Ct questions officer. DA questions, Atty Severson questions. 
State calls officer Albertus, sworn, exam. Cross. Redirect. Recross. 
State calls Cpt Bill Hagstrom. Exam, Exh 1 marked, moves admission of Exhibit1-admitted. No cross. 
State calls Inv Scott Morland, exam. No cross.
Atty Severson has no witnesses. State closes. Atty Severson closes. 
Ct concludes that lawful scope was not exceeded. Ct finds the impounding of the vehicle was reasonable. Reasonable to inventory the vehicle. Inventory search is a valid exception to the warrantless search exception. Motion is denied. Ct finds that the items siezed were siezed search incident to a lawful arrest. 
DA comments on motion to modify bail in 16CF79 and 9 and no bail set in 16CF23. Ct reviews motion, copy made for Atty Severson/DA. DA comment on bail, def due to be released from prison next week, State asks for significant cash bail. Atty Severson comments on bail. 
$5000 cash no contact with Ed McMackiel, Nick Erickson, Jose Smart, Vance StClaire, Todd Lucero except in corrections setting, No MAS-ABSOL no para, follow all jail/prison rules.
